items.name: Virgin Mojito
instructions: Muddle mint leaves, lime wedges, and sugar in a glass.
Fill with crushed ice, pour soda water, and stir.
Garnish with a mint leaf.

items.name: Cucumber Lemonade Cooler
instructions: Blend cucumber and lemon juice, strain into a pitcher, add honey, and mix well.
Pour over ice and top with cold water.

items.name: Classic Margarita
instructions: Rim the glasses with salt.
Shake tequila, triple sec, lime juice, and ice in a shaker.
Strain into glasses and garnish with lime slices.

items.name: Whiskey Sour
instructions: Combine whiskey, lemon juice, and simple syrup in a shaker with ice.
Shake well and strain into glasses over ice.
Garnish with a cherry.

items.name: Banana Almond Smoothie
instructions: Blend bananas, almond milk, almond butter, honey, and ice until smooth.
Pour into glasses and serve chilled.

items.name: Avocado Spinach Smoothie
instructions: Blend avocado, spinach, yogurt, honey, and ice until creamy.
Serve immediately.

items.name: Orange Carrot Juice
ingredients: 2 large carrots (juiced or finely blended and strained)
instructions: Mix the orange and carrot juices with ginger juice in a pitcher.
Stir well and serve over ice.

items.name: Watermelon Mint Juice
instructions: Blend watermelon and mint leaves, strain, and mix in lime juice.
Serve over ice.

items.name: Iced Vanilla Latte
instructions: Pour espresso and vanilla syrup over ice.
Top with cold milk and stir.

items.name: Cappuccino
instructions: Pour steamed milk over espresso in cups.
Top with foam and sprinkle with a pinch of cocoa powder if desired.

items.name: Pork Noodle Casserole
ingredients: ¼ cup chopped red bell pepper
2 (10.5 ounce) cans condensed cream of chicken soup
1 (8 ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C) and grease a 9x13-inch baking pan.
Cook egg noodles according to package instructions and set aside.
Melt butter in a skillet, cook onion, celery, carrots, and bell pepper until softened.
Combine noodles, pork, soup, cheese, corn, sour cream, salt, and pepper. Transfer to baking dish.
Top with bread crumbs and bake for 30-35 minutes until bubbly.

items.name: Mutton Goat Curry
ingredients: 2 pounds goat stew meat, cut into chunks
instructions: Season goat meat with salt, turmeric, and black pepper.
Grind onions into a paste. Cook with spices in coconut oil until fragrant.
Add ginger-garlic paste, tomatoes, and goat meat. Cook until browned.
Transfer to a slow cooker and cook for 2-3 hours on High.
Add spice mix, thicken gravy, and serve garnished with cilantro.

items.name: Red Lobster Shrimp
ingredients: 1 pound jumbo shrimp, peeled and deveined
instructions: Preheat the broiler to 500°F (260°C).
Arrange shrimp in an oven-safe dish and add pinot grigio, butter, lemon juice, garlic, salt, and red pepper.
Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese and broil for 7 minutes.
Garnish with parsley and serve with lemon wedges.

items.name: Grilled Chicken Escalope with Fresh Salsa
ingredients: 1 cup parsley, coriander, green spring onion mix
½ cup spring onion (white part), chopped
instructions: Marinate chicken with salt, pepper, spice powder, and green paste for 30 minutes.
Cook the chicken on a grill or pan until done.
Mix all salsa ingredients in a bowl and refrigerate.
Serve grilled chicken with the fresh salsa.

items.name: Keema Samosa with Yogurt Dip
instructions: Marinate keema with ginger-garlic paste, spices, and curd.
Cook with sautéed onions and dry fruits.
Prepare dough from flour and oil, roll into pancakes, and add filling.
Shape into crescents and fry until golden brown.
Mix yogurt, sugar, salt, cardamom, and rose water for the dip.

items.name: Fish Tacos
ingredients: 2 filets white fish (tilapia, cod, or halibut)
instructions: Season fish with spices. Pan-fry in olive oil until golden and flaky.
Assemble tacos with cabbage, fish, avocado, and cilantro on tortillas.
Top with sour cream or yogurt and serve with lime wedges.

items.name: Brisket Barbacoa Tacos
ingredients: 1kg (2.2 lbs) beef brisket, cut into 5cm cubes
Salsa verde, corn tortillas, diced onion, and radish for serving
instructions: Season brisket with salt. Sear in a pot until browned.
Soak chilies, then blend with garlic, onion, oregano, cinnamon, clove, and vinegar.
Cook beef with sauce in a slow cooker for 12 hours on low.
Shred beef and serve in tortillas with salsa verde and toppings.

items.name: Chicken Biryani
instructions: Fry onions until golden for crispy topping.
Marinate chicken with yogurt, spices, and herbs.
Parboil rice with spices.
Layer cooked rice and marinated chicken, and cook on low heat to form biryani.

items.name: Shrimp Scampi
ingredients: 1 pound large shrimp, peeled and deveined
1/4 cup white wine or chicken broth
instructions: Heat butter and olive oil in a pan over medium heat. Add garlic and sauté until fragrant.
Add shrimp, season with salt and pepper, and cook until pink.
Stir in wine and lemon juice, cook for another minute.
Sprinkle with parsley and serve with pasta or on its own.

items.name: Stuffed Bell Peppers with Ground Beef
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Cut tops off peppers and remove seeds. Place in a baking dish.
Sauté onion and garlic, then add ground beef. Cook until browned.
Mix beef with rice, tomato sauce, Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper.
Stuff peppers with the mixture and top with cheese.
Bake for 30-35 minutes until peppers are tender.

items.name: Creamy Courgette Pasta
ingredients: 300 g garlic and herb cream cheese
150 g Parmesan cheese (grated or vegetarian alternative)
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
instructions: Heat the oil in a large frying pan over medium to high heat. Add the courgettes and cook for 10-15 minutes.
Boil salted water and cook the spaghetti as per instructions.
Drain the pasta and reserve 1 cup of cooking water.
Mix the pasta, courgettes, cream cheese, lemon zest and juice, reserved water, Parmesan, salt, and pepper.
Stir until combined and serve.

items.name: Vegetarian Cottage Pie
instructions: Heat oil in a pan and fry onions, garlic, carrots, and celery for 5 minutes.
Add mushrooms and cook for another 5 minutes.
Mix in flour, thyme, rosemary, and pepper. Cook for 3-5 minutes.
Add lentils, purée, stock, Marmite, and Henderson's Relish. Cook for 30 minutes.
Boil potatoes, mash with butter, salt, and pepper.
Assemble with mash on top and bake at 200°C for 25 minutes.

items.name: Vegetarian Chili
instructions: Cook onions and garlic in oil for 5 minutes.
Add spices, sugar, and seasoning. Cook for 15-20 minutes.
Mix in sweet potato, beans, and tomatoes. Cook for 45-60 minutes.
Mash some beans for texture and serve.

items.name: Vegetarian Moussaka
instructions: Preheat oven to 180°C.
Prepare and fry vegetables.
Simmer tomato and lentil mixture.
Layer tomato mix, aubergines, and potatoes in a dish.
Top with ricotta mix and cheddar.
Bake for 20 minutes.

items.name: Quinoa Salad
instructions: Cook quinoa in stock.
Griddle courgettes and asparagus.
Prepare dressing and combine all ingredients.
Serve with Parmesan shavings.

items.name: Mushroom Wellington
ingredients: 300 g garlic and herb cream cheese
instructions: Roast mushrooms, garlic, and leeks.
Mix filling ingredients.
Assemble Wellington with puff pastry and filling.
Bake at 200°C for 25-30 minutes.

items.name: Cheese & Asparagus Puffs
ingredients: 150 g garlic and herb cream cheese
instructions: Boil asparagus briefly.
Assemble puffs with pastry and filling.
Bake at 200°C for 15-20 minutes.

items.name: Butternut Squash Soup
instructions: Cook onion and garlic with spices.
Add squash and stock. Simmer until soft.
Blend until smooth.

items.name: Sweet Corn and Zucchini Ratatouille
instructions: Sauté onions and garlic.
Add capsicums, zucchini, and corn. Cook until tender.
Mix in herbs and lemon juice. Serve.

items.name: Homemade Ratatouille
instructions: Cook onion, garlic, and carrot.
Simmer with tomatoes and spices.
Layer vegetables over sauce and bake at 375°F for 30 minutes.

items.name: Banana Chiffon Cake
instructions: Preheat oven to 302℉(150℃). Wrap the bottom of a 6-inch round chiffon cake pan with tin foil.
Separate the eggs; keep the egg whites cool in the fridge.
Mix mashed banana and vegetable oil, sift in cake flour, mix until smooth, then add 4 egg yolks and set aside.
Whip egg whites with lemon juice, sugar, and vanilla extract until soft peaks form. Gently fold in the batter.
Pour batter into the cake pan, smooth the surface, and tap to release air pockets.
Place the cake pan in a baking tray with hot water. Bake for 60 minutes or until golden brown.
Cool the cake upside down on a rack, then loosen sides with a spatula to release.
Dust with powdered sugar and serve.

items.name: Cute Cow Roll Cake
instructions: Separate eggs; keep egg whites cool in the fridge.
Mix oil, milk, sifted flour, cornstarch, and salt. Add 1 egg white and combine.
Preheat oven to 302℉(150℃). Line a baking tray with parchment paper.
Whip egg whites with lemon juice, sugar, and vanilla until soft peaks form. Fold into batter.
Reserve a portion of batter, mix with black food coloring, and pipe cow patterns onto baking mat. Bake for 2 minutes.
Pour the remaining batter onto the tray and bake for 20 minutes. Cool on a rack.
For filling, whip cream cheese and sugar until smooth, then whip with heavy cream to stiff peaks.
Spread filling on cake, roll, and chill for 1 hour before slicing.

items.name: Raspberry Pistachio Mousse Cake
instructions: Prepare crust by mixing graham crackers and melted butter, press into molds, and chill.
For raspberry mousse, mix yogurt, sugar, and raspberry sauce. Combine with gelatin and whipped cream, then pour into molds and chill.
For pistachio mousse, mix pistachio sauce, sugar, gelatin, and whipped cream. Pour over raspberry layer and chill.
Prepare cheese mousse with cream cheese, sugar, yogurt, and gelatin. Layer over pistachio mousse and chill.
For topping, melt chocolate with heavy cream and pour over mousse cakes. Decorate with raspberries.

items.name: Tiramisu
instructions: Whip mascarpone with sugar and vanilla extract until smooth.
Whip heavy cream to soft peaks, then fold into mascarpone mixture.
Dip ladyfinger cookies in espresso, layer them at the bottom of a dish.
Spread half the mascarpone mixture over the ladyfingers.
Add another layer of soaked ladyfingers, then top with the remaining mascarpone mixture.
Chill in the refrigerator for 4 hours.
Before serving, sprinkle with cocoa powder and grated dark chocolate.

items.name: Chocolate Lava Cake
instructions: Preheat oven to 425℉(220℃). Butter and flour ramekins.
Melt chocolate and butter together, stirring until smooth.
Whisk eggs and sugar until thickened, then add melted chocolate and vanilla extract.
Fold in flour until combined.
Pour the batter into prepared ramekins, filling halfway.
Bake for 12 minutes until edges are set but the center is soft.
Allow to cool for a minute, then invert onto plates and serve warm.

items.name: Blueberry Muffins
instructions: Preheat oven to 375℉(190℃). Line a muffin tin with paper liners.
Whisk flour, sugar, and baking powder in a bowl.
In another bowl, whisk eggs, milk, melted butter, and vanilla extract.
Fold wet ingredients into dry ingredients until just combined.
Gently fold in blueberries.
Spoon batter into muffin tins and bake for 20-25 minutes.
Cool on a rack before serving.

items.name: Strawberry Shortcake
instructions: Preheat oven to 375℉(190℃). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Mix flour, sugar, and baking powder in a bowl.
Cut in butter until the mixture resembles crumbs.
Add milk and mix until just combined.
Shape dough into rounds, bake for 15-20 minutes.
Slice strawberries and whip cream.
Assemble by layering shortcakes with whipped cream and strawberries.

items.name: Lemon Meringue Pie
instructions: Preheat oven to 350℉(175℃). Bake pie crust until golden brown.
Whisk lemon juice, sugar, and cornstarch in a pot until thickened.
Add egg yolks and butter, cook until smooth.
Whisk egg whites with cream of tartar, then fold into the lemon mixture.
Pour filling into baked crust, bake for 10 minutes.
Cool and serve.

items.name: Lemon Meringue Pie
instructions: Preheat oven to 350℉(175℃). Bake pie crust until golden brown.
Whisk lemon juice, sugar, and cornstarch in a pot until thickened.
Add egg yolks and butter, cook until smooth.
Whisk egg whites with cream of tartar, then fold into the lemon mixture.
Pour filling into baked crust, bake for 10 minutes.
Cool and serve.

items.name: Apple Pie
instructions: Preheat oven to 375℉(190℃). Line pie dish with pie crust.
Mix apple slices, sugar, cinnamon, and nutmeg.
Fill pie crust with the apple mixture and dot with butter.
Cover with a top crust, bake for 45 minutes until golden.
Cool before serving.
